dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 1573 IH: Military and Educational Data Integration Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Ms. Lee of Nevada (for herself, Mr. Schmidt, Mr. Bergman, Mr. Fleischmann, Mr. Moylan, Mr. Case, Mr. McCormick, Mr. Moulton, Ms. Davids of Kansas, Mr. Fields, Mrs. Radewagen, and Mr. Sorensen) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Armed Services

form.official-title: To establish a process to furnish to State educational agencies certain demographic data regarding members of the Armed Forces.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Military and Educational Data Integration Act.

section.header: Process to furnish certain demographic data regarding members of the Armed Forces to State educational agencies

subsection.text: The Secretaries concerned, in consultation with the Secretary of Education, State educational agencies, local educational agencies, and experts in student data and privacy, shall, not later than 18 months after the date of enactment of this Act, establish a data sharing process that enables a State educational agency to—

paragraph.text: access data described in subsection (b) attributable to individuals who graduated high school in the State of such State educational agency; and

subparagraph.text: such State’s statewide longitudinal data system; or
an alternate data system operated by such State.

subsection.text: The data described in this paragraph may include the following information:

paragraph.text: With respect to an individual who is a member of an Armed Force who graduated from secondary school:

subparagraph.text: The highest level of education attained.
The name and location of the educational institution where the member received education described in subparagraph (A).
The name and location of the secondary school from which the individual graduated.
Score on the Armed Forces Qualification Test.
The date the member joined an Armed Force.
The Armed Force of the member.
Rank.
The area of expertise or military occupational specialty.
The date of separation, if applicable.
Any other information determined appropriate by the Secretary concerned.

paragraph.text: With respect to an individual who graduated from secondary school and whose application to join an Armed Force was denied:

subparagraph.text: The highest level of education attained.
The name and location of the school where the individual received education described in subparagraph (A).
The name and location of the secondary school from which the individual graduated.
Score on the Armed Forces Qualification Test.

paragraph.text: Data transmitted through the data sharing process under subsection (a) shall be transmitted confidentially and using the most current standards for data security at the time of transmission.

paragraph.header: Protection of individual privacy and data security
paragraph.text: The Secretaries concerned shall carry out subsection (a) in a manner that protects individual privacy and data security, in accordance with applicable Federal, State, and local privacy laws.
Each Secretary concerned and each State educational agency that accesses data under subsection (a) shall establish, implement, and maintain reasonable data security practices to protect—

subparagraph.text: the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of data; and
data against unauthorized access.
the Secretary of Defense; or
the Secretary of Homeland Security.

paragraph.text: The terms local educational agency, secondary school, and State educational agency have the meanings given such terms in section 8101 of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 7801).
